definition.name: NXmpes
definition.doc: This is the most general application definition for multidimensional photoelectron spectroscopy.

field.name: start_time
field.doc: Datetime of the start of the measurement.

group.doc: Contact information of at least the user of the instrument or the investigator who performed this experiment. Adding multiple users if relevant is recommended.

field.name: name
field.doc: Name of the user.

field.name: affiliation
field.doc: Name of the affiliation of the user at the point in time when the experiment was performed.

field.name: address
field.doc: Full address (street, street number, ZIP, city, country) of the user's affiliation.

field.name: email
field.doc: Email address of the user.

field.name: orcid
field.doc: Author ID defined by https://orcid.org/.

group.doc: The source used to generate the primary photons. Properties refer strictly to parameters of the source, not of the output beam. For example, the energy of the source is not the optical power of the beam, but the energy of the electron beam in a synchrotron and so on.

field.name: probe
field.doc: Type of probe. In photoemission it's always photons, so the full NIAC list is restricted.

field.name: distance
field.doc: Distance of the point of evaluation of the beam from the sample surface.

field.name: energy_resolution
field.doc: Energy resolution of the analyser with the current setting. May be linked from a NXcalibration.

field.name: scheme
field.doc: Scheme of the electron collection column.

group.name: field_aperture
group.doc: The size and position of the field aperture inserted in the column. To add additional or other apertures use the APERTURE group of NXcollectioncolumn.

group.name: contrast_aperture
group.doc: The size and position of the contrast aperture inserted in the column. To add additional or other apertures use the APERTURE group of NXcollectioncolumn.

group.name: entrance_slit
group.doc: Size, position and shape of the entrance slit in dispersive analyzers. To add additional or other slits use the APERTURE group of NXenergydispersion.

group.name: exit_slit
group.doc: Size, position and shape of the exit slit in dispersive analyzers. To add additional or other slits use the APERTURE group of NXenergydispersion.

field.name: amplifier_type
field.doc: Type of electron amplifier in the first amplification step.

field.name: detector_type
field.doc: Description of the detector type.

field.name: raw
field.doc: Raw data before calibration.

group.doc: Manipulator for positioning of the sample.
Document an event of data processing, reconstruction, or analysis for this data. Describe the appropriate axis calibrations for your experiment using one or more of the following NXcalibrations

field.name: applied
field.doc: Has an energy calibration been applied?

field.name: calibrated_axis
field.doc: This is the calibrated energy axis to be used for data plotting.

field.name: applied
field.doc: Has an angular calibration been applied?

field.name: calibrated_axis
field.doc: This is the calibrated angular axis to be used for data plotting.

field.name: applied
field.doc: Has an spatial calibration been applied?

field.name: calibrated_axis
field.doc: This is the calibrated spatial axis to be used for data plotting.

field.name: applied
field.doc: Has an momentum calibration been applied?

field.name: calibrated_axis
field.doc: This is the momentum axis to be used for data plotting.

field.name: chemical_formula
field.doc: The chemical formula of the sample. For mixtures use the NXsample_component group in NXsample instead.

group.name: sample_history
group.doc: A descriptor to keep track of the treatment of the sample before entering the photoemission experiment. Ideally, a full report of the previous operations, in any format (NXnote allows to add pictures, audio, movies). Alternatively, a reference to the location or a unique identifier or other metadata file. In the case these are not available, free-text description.

field.name: atom_types
field.doc: List of comma-separated elements from the periodic table that are contained in the sample. If the sample substance has multiple components, all elements from each component must be included in `atom_types`.

field.name: preparation_date
field.doc: Date of preparation of the sample for the XPS experiment (i.e. cleaving, last annealing).

group.name: preparation_description
group.doc: Description of the surface preparation technique for the XPS experiment, i.e. UHV cleaving, in-situ growth, sputtering/annealing etc. Ideally, a full report of the previous operations, in any format(NXnote allows to add pictures, audio, movies). Alternatively, a reference to the location or a unique identifier or other metadata file. In the case these are not available, free-text description.

field.name: temperature
field.doc: In the case of a fixed temperature measurement this is the scalar temperature of the sample. In the case of an experiment in which the temperature is changed and recoded, this is an array of length m of temperatures. This should be a link to /entry/instrument/manipulator/sample_temperature.

field.name: data
field.doc: Represents a measure of one- or more-dimensional photoemission counts, where the varied axis may be for example energy, momentum, spatial coordinate, pump-probe delay, spin index, temperature, etc. The axes traces should be linked to the actual encoder position in NXinstrument or calibrated axes in NXprocess.
